can verify whether the integral exists or is finite. For example
Likewise, the accuracy of results is not verified by the function.

is typically reliable for integrals that are numerically favorable, but it is not guaranteed to converge to a correct value for all possible intervals and integrands. This function is provided for convenience; for critical applications, check results against other integration methods.
The default limits of integration are endpoints of the interval of width
Function for which integral is calculated. Takes only one argument. The default is the identity mapping f(x) = x.
Lower and upper bound for integration. Default is set to the support of the distribution.

If True, the integral is corrected by the conditional probability of the integration interval.  The return value is the expectation of the function, conditional on being in the given interval. Default is False.

children.param: Additional keyword arguments are passed to the integration routine.

data.value: Calculate expected value of a function with respect to the distribution by numerical integration.
To understand the effect of the bounds of integration consider
The slight deviation from 1 is due to numerical integration.
The integrand can be treated as a complex-valued function by passing
